attributes.action: bring about legislation enabling the introduction of Intelligent Speed Adaptation (ISA) systems throughout the UK at the earliest opportunity.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Intelligent Speed Adaptation will provide the opportunity to ensure speed
limits are observed, and to set speed limits that are in the overall public
interest, rather than being limited to those that are acceptable only to
drivers. It is a tool that will release urban designers from having to
design around vehicles. Road humps, chicanes and narrows will become a
thing of the past.

In the longer term ISA will allow speed limits to be finely tuned to the
needs of particular streets, such as varying them by time of day or weather.
Speed limits could be lowered when and where children are likely to be
around, to help ensure their safety On other roads and at other times, it
may be possible to raise speed limits if this is in the public interest.

With development and planning policy being dictated to a large degree by the
motor vehicle since the 1930s, ISA, by allowing the worst effects of
vehicles to be controlled, including accidents, community severance, noise,
and loss of localism, could provide the opportunity for energetic urban
designers to reinvent streets and the public realm.
